intro: Trichopteryx grisea, commonly known as the gray trichopteryx, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Trichopteryx grisea is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
